intro: Tarenna hosei, commonly known as the Madagascar star anise, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and dark, glossy berries that resemble anise seeds. Tarenna hosei thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its unique appearance and aromatic properties make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
